intro: Ruschia incumbens, commonly known as the narrowleaf ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, upright growth with narrow, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the warmer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Ruschia incumbens is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
